stem: A 25-year-old pregnant lady presents with fever and sore throat during the flu season. Then she developed a non-productive cough and dyspnea with features of hypoxia. The most likely diagnosis is
disc: Viruses are common causes of community-acquired pneumonia (CAP), especially during flu season. Influenza remains the most important viral cause of CAP. Influenza A and B can cause outbreaks, particularly during the winter season.
tags: Medicine, Pneumonia, Viral Pneumonia, Respiratory Medicine, Pregnancy
